title: hotrstuff
text: download ESMs, ’d still download wget scripts chosen CMIP6 repository. suggest using: https://aims2.llnl.gov/search. want follow along, use wget scripts data/raw/wget folder. , can use wget scripts; just make sure change arguments. , run download_ESM function run wget scripts found folder.
code: base_dir <- "." # Just start relative to this location  htr_download_ESM(   indir = file.path(base_dir, "data", "raw", "wget"), # input directory   outdir = file.path(base_dir, "data", "raw", "tos") # output directory )

title: hotrstuff
text: now merge files model-variable-scenario-frequency combination. result just 1 .nc file model-variable-scenario-frequency combination.
code: htr_merge_files(   indir = file.path(base_dir, "data", "raw", "tos"), # input directory   outdir = file.path(base_dir, "data", "proc", "merged", "tos"), # output directory   year_start = 1985, # earliest year across all the scenarios considered (e.g., historical, ssp126, ssp245, ssp585)   year_end = 2100 # latest year across all the scenarios considered )

title: hotrstuff
text: now want keep years ’re interested . example, want make sure future projections, want look 2020-2100.
code: htr_slice_period(   indir = file.path(base_dir, "data", "proc", "merged", "tos"), # input directory   outdir = file.path(base_dir, "data", "proc", "sliced", "tos"), # output directory   freq = "Omon", # ocean, daily   scenario = "ssp",   year_start = 2020,   year_end = 2100,   overwrite = FALSE ) #> [1] "ACCESS-ESM1-5_ssp126" #> [1] "CanESM5_ssp126"

title: hotrstuff
text: function fixes calendar days, days leap years. standardize calendar across different models.
code: htr_fix_calendar(indir = file.path(base_dir, "data", "proc", "sliced", "tos")) # will be rewritten #> tos_Omon_ACCESS-ESM1-5_ssp126_r1i1p1f1_merged_20200101-21001231.nc does not have leap days #> tos_Omon_CanESM5_ssp126_r1i1p1f1_merged_20200101-21001231.nc does not have leap days

title: hotrstuff
text: created two functions: ) changes frequency monthly (monthly_frequency()), ii) changes frequency yearly (yearly_frequency()), ’ve started monthly data , didn’t run monthly_frequency() (works). Uncomment code ’re using daily data changing monthly frequency. create new file yearly frequency. rest analyses, ’ll continue yearly data.
code: htr_change_freq(   freq = "monthly",   indir = file.path(base_dir, "data", "proc", "sliced", "tos"), # input directory   outdir = file.path(base_dir, "data", "proc", "yearly", "tos") ) htr_change_freq(   freq = "yearly",   indir = file.path(base_dir, "data", "proc", "sliced", "tos"), # input directory   outdir = file.path(base_dir, "data", "proc", "yearly", "tos") )

title: hotrstuff
text: climate models different grids, now need regrid standardize grid. requires base, empty raster made automatically regrid_esm(). Let’s try plot . Just plotting first time point two models.
code: htr_regrid_esm(   indir = file.path(base_dir, "data", "proc", "yearly", "tos"),   outdir = file.path(base_dir, "data", "proc", "regridded", "yearly", "tos"),   cell_res = 0.25,   layer = "annual" ) #> [1] "ACCESS-ESM1-5 ssp126" #> [1] "CanESM5 ssp126" getwd() #> [1] "/Users/eve067/GitHub/hotrstuff/vignettes" models <- list.files(file.path(base_dir, "data", "proc", "regridded", "yearly", "tos"), full.names = TRUE) model1 <- terra::rast(models[1]) plot(model1$tos_1) model2 <- rast(models[2]) plot(model2$tos_1)

title: hotrstuff
text: now, 2 models, models, just need input list model names vector model_list argument. , plot see looks.
code: htr_create_ensemble(   indir = file.path(base_dir, "data", "proc", "regridded", "yearly", "tos"), # input directory   outdir = file.path(base_dir, "data", "proc", "ensemble", "mean", "tos"), # output directory   model_list = c("ACCESS-ESM1-5", "CanESM5"), # list of models for ensemble   variable = "tos", # variable name   freq = "Omon", # original frequency of data   scenario = "ssp126", # emission scenario   mean = TRUE # if false, takes the median ) ensemble_model <- list.files(file.path(base_dir, "data", "proc", "ensemble", "mean", "tos"), full.names = TRUE) ensemble <- rast(ensemble_model) plot(ensemble$tos_1)

what: Facilitates the rapid download, wrangling and processing of Earth System Model (ESM) output from the Coupled Model Intercomparison Project (CMIP)
title: Facilitates the rapid download, wrangling and processing of Earth System Model (ESM) output from the Coupled Model Intercomparison Project (CMIP)
text: goal hotrstuff facilitate rapid download, wrangling processing Earth System Model (ESM) output Coupled Model Intercomparison Project (CMIP). get started, need download wget scripts chosen CMIP6 repository. use: https://aims2.llnl.gov/search. hotrstuff makes easy : Download, Merge files, Regrid chosen resolution, Slice required timeframe, Crop requested spatial area, Create mean/median ensembles variables, scenarios etc.

title: Facilitates the rapid download, wrangling and processing of Earth System Model (ESM) output from the Coupled Model Intercomparison Project (CMIP)
text: hotrstuff requires Climate Data Operators (CDO) software installed prior use. CDO software collection many operators standard processing climate forecast model data. operators include simple statistical arithmetic functions, data selection subsampling tools, spatial interpolation. hotrstuff leverages power CDO, within R environment. CDO installation can found CDO installer website

title: Facilitates the rapid download, wrangling and processing of Earth System Model (ESM) output from the Coupled Model Intercomparison Project (CMIP)

code: brew install cdo
